qas.question: When did Switzerland sign the Kyoto Protocol?
When did Switzerland ratify the Kyoto Protocol
What was formed by Switzerland, Mexico, and the Republic of Korea?
What percentage of recyclable materials are being recycled in Switzerland?
How did the 2010 Global Green Economy Index rank Switzerland?

answers.text: among the top 10 green economies in the world

context: Switzerland has one of the best environmental records among nations in the developed world; it was one of the countries to sign the Kyoto Protocol in <a0_0>1998<a0_0/> and ratified it in <a1_0>2003<a1_0/>. With Mexico and the Republic of Korea it forms the <a2_0>Environmental Integrity Group (EIG)<a2_0/>. The country is heavily active in recycling and anti-littering regulations and is one of the top recyclers in the world, with <a3_0>66% to 96%<a3_0/> of recyclable materials being recycled, depending on the area of the country. The 2014 Global Green Economy Index ranked Switzerland <a4_0>among the top 10 green economies in the world<a4_0/>.
